A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
As a die-hard Star Wars fan\, I wanted this movie to win in every way. And as a fan of Ryan Johnson's "Looper\," I was looking forward to a new and unexpected twist that would rival the reveal of Darth Vader as Luke's father. Instead\, I was left with a visually stunning movie that felt flat and often silly. 

Spoilers ahead:

The downward slide began when Luke tossed his lightsaber nonchalantly over his shoulder in K2SO fashion. This was the moment that Episode VII so beautifully prepared for us\, and this lightsaber\, along with many other mysteries such as Rey's parents and Snoke's identity\, felt thrown away as the minutes passed by.

Other moments that felt completely false were Leiah's force moment\, the reversal of Poe's mutiny\, most of the time in the casino city\, and the seemingly useless slide into the dark hole on the island.

While the costume and environment designs were amazing and I loved the concept of the red-soiled planet\, the gaping plot holes and lack of meaningful character development made this one of my least favorite movies in the Star Wars saga to date.
